elements.title: Giado concentration camp (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Libyan Jews and Arabs traded and bartered with each other at the fence of the Giado concentration camp (pictured)?

elements.title: Gloria Dickie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that environmental journalist Gloria Dickie wrote her thesis on how cities in Colorado changed garbage laws to prevent bear incursions?

elements.title: Brunel University's lecture centre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Brunel University's lecture centre has been described as "imposing" and "frightening", but also as "an expressive centrepiece" and "a brutalist classic"?

elements.title: Benjamin Jackson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Benjamin Jackson was likely paid at least $300 to fight in the American Civil War as Lewis Saunders?

elements.title: Chamber of Dutch Culture (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, of the three presidents of the Chamber of Dutch Culture, two were arrested and one was assassinated?

elements.title: Eurovision Song Contest 1989 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the inclusion of two preteen competing performers at the Eurovision Song Contest 1989 led to the introduction of an age rule for participants at future contests?

elements.title: shot three people dead (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a gunman who, in 1960, shot three people dead in Sheffield, England, was deported to Somalia, where he was killed in a shoot-out while "running amok"?

elements.title: Catherine G. Williams (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Iowa government social worker Catherine G. Williams started out as a tap dancer?

elements.title: Banner in the Sky (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Banner in the Sky inspired a Canadian dentist to climb the Matterhorn?
